content.description: Start on the ramp leading to Crank Up - at the roof climb up and right, finish by climbing the face to the top.
content.location: Start on ramp leading to Crank Up

content.description: Start same as Crank up. Traverse left for 15 feet along a prominent horizontal crack until below a small overhang. Step to right around the overhang and climb the face.  Formerly known as Close but no Cigar..
Climb up to the overhang, then head right and up on good holds.
content.protection: Probably could lead if you wanted, most will TR.
content.location: On the upstream arete of the cliff, follow the line of least resistance.

content.description: Start same as Cornice. Climb up the wall and follow the thin left slanting crack through the bulge.
Start below a large chimney 15 feet left of the Cornice - climb up the cracks and through the chimney.
Start: 5 feet right of a left facing corner and 30 feet left of Cornice.   Climb onto a narrow ledge below the bulge. Using flakes, climb the bulge and continue up and right through the overhangs.
content.location: 5 feet right of a left facing corner and 30 feet left of Cornice.

content.description: Start: 100 yards downstream from Armbuster and 30 yards downstream from Right Cheek (Cornice).   Scramble down a series of ledges.   Note:  This is the best descent route for the climbs between Conroy Wasn't Here and The Nose.
content.location: 100 yards downstream from Armbuster and 30 yards downstream from Right Cheek (Cornice).

content.description: Start 15 feet left of Lawrence's Last, below several flakes in the bulging wall - climb the bulging wall using flakes and small handholds to gain a ledge. Finish by climbing the thin face above the ledge.
content.location: about 30 feet left of the Cornice

content.description: Start same as Crank up - climb the left crack.
content.location: Cornice area between the nose and cornice.

content.description: This combination is for climbers who lament the shortness of Great Falls routes.Climb up Crankup (5.10), traverse 6 feet left to the top of Cranko (5.10). No fair resting on the top. Downclimb Cranko until you are standing on the ledge that leads left to the Tiparillo traverse. Traverse left and finish on Tiparillo (5.11).
content.protection: TR from top of Tiparillo. A fall from early on Crankup will result in a long but safe swing.

content.description: Start on the ramp below two parallel cracks in the overhang wall - climb the right crack
content.location: Cornice area btwn the nose and cornice

content.description: Start: Same as Cornice.   Climb face to overhangs.
Climb through the large overhang at the crack in the overhang.
Start in the corner, climb up into the chimney section, then bust a move out the big roof on good holds. Feels like the Gunks for a brief moment.
content.protection: Most will top rope, though you could lead it. Take small to medium gear, some of the placements might take some creativity.
content.location: The central line on the cliff, look for the obvious chimney/corner leading to a big roof.

content.description: Start: Below a shallow chimney and left facing corner 35 feet left of Cornice.   Follow the chimney and corner up the wall.
content.location: Below a shallow chimney and left facing corner 35 feet left of Cornice.

content.description: Cornice is the next section of the main gorge downstream from Bird's Nest. The top of the cliff is just a few yards off the river trail and there is easy access to setting up all the top ropes. The climbs here offer a variety of difficulties. The actual climb named Cornice may be the single best moderate climb in the Potomac Gorge.
